website_summaries.verdict: It’s fairly affordable, quiet, colorful, greatly customizable, and displays the eye-catching ray shading, environmental detail, and buttery smooth gameplay that 4K gaming was made for.
pros: Up to 3 times the performance of previous models
Expansive range of options precisely tune to your gaming needs
cons: It’s as quiet as a dual-fan graphics card is going to get, but some may still opt for a model with 3 fans

customer_reviews.title: RTX2070 BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 6Gb 1060 to this card and its like night and day. I can play any modern game on my 1080p 144hz monitor with max settings without a hiccup. With the EVGA X1 software, I have it 110Mhz over core (boosts to 2025Mhz) and temps do not exceed 65C gaming. Its near silent too! Best card Ive ever bought! ( TimeSpy 3DMark test = 9000 ) paired up with an i7 7700K @ 4.8Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Chad C.

customer_reviews.title: Pay to Play
customer_reviews.text: A good upgrade over the base 2070 from EVGA ... better cooler and better bin chips for better clock speed.
customer_reviews.author: MrZ

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THE 2080
customer_reviews.text: It is a shame that Nvidia chose to charge an arm and a leg for the 2080 and 2080ti, you will NOT get a substantial increase in fps from the 2080 over the 2070, especially for almost being twice as much, it is quite comical. If you are upgrading from the 900 series or even a 1050-1070 then this is a great option, if you already have a 1080 or 1080ti then wait for the next iteration, because Nvidia missed the mark with their high end cards this year.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie G

customer_reviews.title: Failed and has artifacts
customer_reviews.text: I heard about the RTX series having some quality issue. But I decided to give a try. 5 days later, the card failed to boot into windows. After I reinstalled the driver by connected to intel card. Then, I got those artifacts randomly when I playing PUBG. First time try NVDIA and EVGA, very disappointed. I replaced this card and will test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Ruiyang Chen

customer_reviews.title: Card failed within 6 days of purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and received card on 11/15 and card was dead on 11/21. Could not boot into windows 10 with the card installed. Was able to boot into safe mode to reinstall drivers with no luck. Reset windows and computer would hard lock on boot and could not start with gpu installed however I was able to boot using the integrated intel graphics just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolas

customer_reviews.title: Modern GTX 1080 touching 1080Ti level
customer_reviews.text: Tested with benchmarks so far and this seems way faster than 1080 but a tad slower than 1080Ti. Paired with Ryzen 2700, no problem reaching 9K+ on Timespy. 42Mh/s on ETH mining. =D
customer_reviews.author: Joms

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck in the market right now.
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1. It has lights 2. Costs 300 dollars less than 2080 and can keep up with performance with a little bit of tweaking and overclocking. 3. 240 fps stable in fortnite and crysis ( not really but decent ) 4. Massive heat sink which allows for better cooling and performance overall. 5. The box it comes in is decoration- worthy. 6. G-Sync Cons 1. It’s big 2. Nothing really. Been using it for about 3 weeks right now, hasn’t given me problems with overclockin or anything. I’m 13 so sorry if I’m not being too detailed. My rig’s specs: -Ryzen 7 2700x -32 gb DDR4 RAM G.SKILL TRIDENTZ -800 Watt PSU EVGA -B-450 Mobo -PG258Q
customer_reviews.author: Maria Claudia Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Way too soon!
customer_reviews.text: I knew these 20-series cards have some quality issues, but I chose to ignore those reviews. My card was fine for the day, the it failed for the first time in 3DMark benchmark, the screen froze and a reboot fixed the issue. Then it failed again when I was playing PUBG, the error said “your card is physically removed”. This time, my game crashed again, then I rebooted and entered this game again, then I finally got those artifacts. Good Quality Control, Nvidia!
customer_reviews.author: George Tang

customer_reviews.title: Artifact + Error Message
customer_reviews.text: Should have listen to the 1 star reviews on this one. Have this card for about a month now. The issue I've come by is the Artifact freezing + straight up crashing with VIDEO_SCHEDULER INTERNAL_ERROR. This occurs even when idling. Timing of crashes generally takes place anywhere from 10 mins to an hour apart. Held off on returning it sooner as I was hoping for a driver update that will fix it. Apparently, the new drivers did not change a thing. Will be returning the card now and staying away from 20xx cards.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Vang

customer_reviews.title: Well built card that performs better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I know there has been a lot of hate for this series in general, but this card has genuinely blown me away. Most stuff I can run in 4k maxed out. Ray tracing I can run at 1080 maxed out. It's a great card. Looks great too, and its quiet
customer_reviews.author: Gary Greene

customer_reviews.title: its a great card
customer_reviews.text: ive had this card for almost two weeks and its work like you want to. i get like 110 to 120 fps and crazy response times on BF5 on ultra settings. Everything runs buttery smooth and i just got my first 144 hz monitor and god damn is it beautiful. around 80-75 fps when dx12 rtx ultra is on. no artifacts so far or any weird bugs, just updated all my drives, started playing and the card still is worked perfectly. im keeping faith that it stays that way. ill keep this comment updated if anything happens..
customer_reviews.author: Austin Rivada

customer_reviews.title: 2nd card DoA
customer_reviews.text: Hi EVGA, I know you're reading this. This is my 2nd EVGA RTX 2070 card that does not work correctly. My first card would crash my entire PC with artifacts everywhere and my second card here crashes with engine errors about device not responding correctly and then the computer proceeds to lock up requiring me to restart. This is absolutely unacceptable for the over inflated price range these cards are asking for. I'm sure most of the fault is on Nvidia and their horrendous gpus, but I am still extremely disappointed and frustrated. At least Intel knew how to deliver customers decent products (albeit heavily overpriced) when they had virtually no competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Big upgrade.  Great picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge upgrade for me, but I was able to compare it side by side with my brother's AMD video card (a generation older) and it was night and day. It plugged right in and has been running great. I'm only running it 1440, but it has NO issues with any game I've used so far. I haven't had it long though, 2 months, so I can't speak to durability. I thought it was better bang for the buck than the 2080 ($300 less at the time I got it) at this point since no games are really designed around the ray trace technology.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dale

customer_reviews.title: 20fps at 1080p when using RTX why even bother
customer_reviews.text: What a scam NVIDIA. Why even sell a feature that drops the FPS so low it makes the game unplayable. Very frustrated with this card also the clock speeds are terrible and the thermals are garbage on this card. Go for the 2080ti founders or nothing at all this card is just not going to deliver the true RTX experience. 4K gaming was 40 - 60 FPS depending on settings but mostly trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good card (some coil whine)
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the GTX 960 and i couldn't be happier. I got this card because i want to start getting into VR a little. Card is running cool and quiet. EVGA is a bit more expensive but you get a high quality card that runs at top performance. You can never go wrong with EVGA. (Update) Unfortunately my card is experiencing some coil whine. It is not horrible but it is there. It only does it when my FPS is really high like in wow where i am getting 250+ fps. Now i use headphones and don't hear it but some gamers that use speakers may be annoyed by it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike37130

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from GTX 970
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a 1440p rig with 144hz gsync. It replaces a GTX 970. With the new card I've cranked up everything to max and get >100FPS. I'm satisfied with this. I mostly play pubg, overwatch and black ops 4 these days. Overwatch isn't super graphics intensive so there was no difference there as the 970 handled everything well. But pubg and black ops 4 have a noticeable improvement with textures, draw distance, anti-aliasing and frame rate. The 970 became a hand me down
customer_reviews.author: C. Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Vram! Ultra is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: THE PRICE IS HIGH BECAUSE NVIDIA BAKED THE TARIF INTO THE MSRP WORLDWIDE. If you're even considering a 2070 over a 2080, make sure you opt for the best subseries of cards. The EVGA 2070 Ultra model not only comes with a monster of a cooling unit, but SAMSUNG VRAM! The most important part of selecting a card these days! The card failures and RMA's of other brands are all because of cheap Micron ram failing under load, sometimes for no reason at all.
customer_reviews.author: StykeTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Great - When it works.
customer_reviews.text: The 2070 in general is quite a great card, even for 4k. The cooler on this one is especially good. Even pegged at 100% usage for 3 hours straight this card maintained 65 degrees even at a slight overclock, giving a lot of headroom for further overclocking. However, this is an RTX 2070, and has the potential to suffer the infamous "space invaders" artifacting issue. This occured with my card after 3 weeks of use. In my case, after 2 days after the initial signs of the issue, the card stopped working entirely and needed RMA. Keep this in mind when buying!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Much needed upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this card to upgrade from a GTX 970 also from EVGA. I love their cards. I had been shopping the market for a while. I finally decided it was time to make the purchase, especially since Nvidia was also giving out codes for Anthem and Battlefield 5. I thought this was a manufacturer thing since I was seeing it offered from all sellers, so I thought it was safe to say that is not the case if you purchase it through Amazon. I'm really bummed to find out they they aren't offering the codes like other sellers. Really sucks to miss out on a good promotion, over all though the card itself is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: PC Guy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful card that, unfortunately, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought an Amazon Warehouse open box, card looked to be like new with the box and most of the accessories (missing adapter cable). The card turned on, fans spun up, lights on, but started crashing as soon as the Nvidia drivers were installed. Tried to run some games and benchmarks but got nothing but artifacts/black screens/crashes. Tried DDU/reinstall latest drivers - same thing. My RTX 2060 runs fine on the same system. Welp, this is going back. :(
customer_reviews.author: JTL

customer_reviews.title: Great Card!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now and it has been great! Now that the 30XX are out if you can get these on sale do so. Do keep in mind alot of times people think just because you have a great GPU your games will play better., Not the case. Be sure your CPU can handle this GPU or you will have CPU BOTTLENECK. I am running mine on a i7-4770K and had to underclock my GPU to get the performance I wanted. Yes I had to underclock it. I can run Fortnite at 140FPS, Warzone at 80 FPS Rise of Tomb Raider at 60 FPS and yes, it runs CRYSIS.
customer_reviews.author: pscomplete

customer_reviews.title: Great card, fans like to click on warm-up
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it's supposed to do at cool temps and with ease. But the fans click, and usually stop after it warms up. You can read the forums to learn about all the various theories why.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The box looks impressive and quality. There's a bigger version, but it s okay if you don't have enough money to spend. You can watch video in 4k and 8k without any problem. Games are operating in the highest settings. Good ventilation. Just a month's use and even the best investment. I'm not a person to spend large sums of money and thanks to Amazon you have the option of paying certain products on 5 payments.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: PC Crashing and Rebooting after Installing this card.
customer_reviews.text: After Installing the EVGA RTX 2070 my PC Crashing, other users also reporting the same problem. I logs in event viewer but occasionally pc rebooting during video play back and even browsing. I disable the hardware acceleration in Chrome. Uninstalled the Drivers using DDU and reinstalled it again. will check for some time and updates.
customer_reviews.author: Atik Ansari

customer_reviews.title: It work but its not a new card.
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression this was a NEW unused graphics card and It works great. To my surprise I decided to activate the Free Game BUT the Key was already taken and in use. RED FLAG, This box must have been open and then repackaged and sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: Dom Mancusae

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very fast performance, and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Gigabyte Radeon Vega 64 card that was causing a lot of issues. This card has been great and solved all of the issues I was having and even showed better performance with less noise compared to the Radeon card. My only con, or a suggestion for improvement, is the Nvidia software, which could use a bit of an update and less infiltration for marketing of games and other programs. When I install driver on my computer I just want them to run my card and give me simple access to the necessary settings. I don’t need my video card drivers to sell me more games.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome RTX card
customer_reviews.text: I got this card for my first PC build in about 15 years. It came in a heavily padded box, the installation was quick and easy, and the card performs very well/stays cool throughout. I'm gaming at 1080p, using an i5-9600K and this card together -- I've yet to find a game that drops below the 60 frames that my cheapo non-gaming monitor can produce -- including Battlefield 5 with all settings maxed, The Division 2 (which is optimized for the Radeon/AMD combo), etc. It's a good card with good performance, and a good amount of fast VRAM.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Fast and not $1000
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got lucky in the chip lottery, but touching nothing on the clocks and it's exceeding a 1080ti on almost every benchmark. The thing is insane. Minor Update: The fans have been extremely quiet, but the GPU has coil whine, fairly strong. Doesn't bother me in the case I have. Just something to note
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: ! Upgrade !
customer_reviews.text: From an EVGA 980 ti SSC to an EVGA RTX 2070 As a Content Creator I use Ue4, Houdini, Quixel Megascans & Mixer, Substance Painter & Photoshop. While Streaming. Lately the 980ti started to BSoD my PC So I decided to upgrade , I was able to get the card for 100 usd a week which helped greatly. Thank You Amazon Hopefully EVGA RTX will carry me another 4 years. Phantek Enthoo Primo  Deepcool Captain 360  4ghz Skylake/32 gb DDR4 Corsair/M.2 & 2 Samsung T5 Portable SSD - 500GB - USB 3.1 External
customer_reviews.author: Number S

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot. But solid quality
customer_reviews.text: Very bulky. But what do you expect with a 2.75 slot GPU. Not as heavy as you may think but it does have some over clocking hiccups. (Msi/precision x1) the card gets hot on memory which has been a known issue of memory dying out on these. But with just clock speeds and max power limit. It's pretty close to a 2080. Worth the money but would recommend water cooling it for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Smith

customer_reviews.title: GPU overheating after 2 months of use. UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use the GPU is overheating causing my computer to crash after immediate start-up, making the monitor turn to a random color. I registered my product with EVGA and I was able to go through their RMA process to replace the GPU. Excellent customer service and response makes up for the unit failing.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Rummell

customer_reviews.title: A Beast!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Artifacts after 18 months running out of the box. Pursuing warranty with EVGA but still cost $70 to package/insure/ship back. My EVGA 970 also failed under warranty previously. My next card will likely not be EVGA. *********** This thing is a beast. Running 1440/144 with ease. I like the fans aren't always on and according to temperature monitors it is staying cool. It's in a new case so I can't compare noise to my old 1070 but it is very quiet. Good bang for the buck. There's always something else faster/better/more expensive. I tend to buy behind the bleeding edge as I don't see the benefit in the very top end with my gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Fury

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: EVGA has always been a pretty good board partner for Nvidia, and their GPU's have always had really good build quality and amazing cooling, as well as pre overclocking so you don't need to do it yourself which is a plus for anyone wanting to game to the max with their hardware! Though beware as a lot of RTX cards have all had issues with their initial line-ups, this particular buy I had to get an RMA from EVGA because it started having problems 4 days after amazon's return window closed. So beware that if you buy non super GPU's you have a potentially bad GPU... However I will recommend EVGA GPU's to anyone and everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade coming from the 900 series NVIDIA
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 970 to this card. Price isn't worth coming from a 1070 or 1080, but coming from the 900 series this has been a very big upgrade and I am very pleased. The increased performance is noticeable. I do gaming and some 3D rendering with this card and have had a very good experience. You can look up the specs and benchmarks on plenty of sites, but from a human perception angle this is noticeably a huge improvement over most previous generations. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing until it dies
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this card was amazing. It felt like there was nothing I couldn't run at 1440p ultra settings on a 34 inch Alienware. I built a new machine around this card and out of the box it ran like Rocky Balboa in Rocky 2. Sadly, after about 2 months it suddenly died. It started with artifacts and quickly went to black screens before it went to nothing. Had to RMA the card. Fortunately EVGA is a good company but beware the rtx cards, they have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tory M. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: I'm not really a big Gamer but I want a good card for graphic art - now I have one
customer_reviews.text: I looked around Battlefield V just to get an idea of what this card can do. The detail in the imagery is beyond words. My old card was NOTHING in comparison, but I only spent about 150 on that when I bought it new. While the cost of the new card is over 3x the one its replacing, the old adage is true; you get what you pay for. I included a video showing a bit of Battlefield V. I recommend this graphics card without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Venge

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with my purchase. Overall it’s a great graphics card. I play a lot of demanding games and this graphics card gets the job done. Some of my thoughts afterwards are that I should’ve bought a 11gb graphics card just because the frame rate isn’t what I wanted it to be. But if your someone that happy with 60-180 FPS this GPU is for you!! Again I love this GPU I’m just a bit of a computer enthusiast so I’m always look for the higher frames.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Good quality card. Liked it.
customer_reviews.text: Cooling is good. Temperature can hardly go beyond 65 celsius degree while gaming at max settings (AAA games). Able to run all sort of games at max 2k/4k. No issue so far after being used for 3 to 4 months. Hope no issue in future.
customer_reviews.author: Ng Tian Xun

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but the driver issues are real
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strictly to increase my fps in apex legends a very popular game, and it often crashes where my 980 never did. Hardware seems solid, i will update this review if i find a fix, or if i have hardware issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle O.

customer_reviews.title: Why ask about durability when is less than one month old?
customer_reviews.text: Terrific Video Card, outclasses my GTX1080, was on sale over Christmas so I jumped at it. Look at Benchmark. UserBenchmarks: Game 129%, Desk 164%, Work 139% CPU: Intel Core i7-8700 - 106.9% GPU: Nvidia RTX 2070 - 136.9% SSD: Adata XPG SX8200 NVMe PCIe M.2 960GB - 349.5% SSD: SanDisk Extreme Pro 480GB - 110.8% HDD: Seagate Desktop SSHD 1TB - 97.7% RAM: Unknown DDR4 3000 2OZ 2x8GB - 81.3% MBD: MSI Z370-A PRO (MS-7B48) date = 12/23/18
customer_reviews.author: Janet C. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Almost worked for a 2 whole months.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second 2070. First one died after 5 months. RMA’d it, got the current one on June 20th. It died on August 15th. Either I have horrible luck or these cards have serious flaws. Im going to RMA this one, sell it, and just get some of my money back. I’ll be going back to my 1070ti.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Severe quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could review this product for how well it works but when someone in the factory physically damages it and then decides the package it up and I assume imagines that the recipient can't use it and has to sent it back, that they wont mind any of that.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: 2070 is only a slight hop from the last gen
customer_reviews.text: It is not a great upgrade from older models. Stuttering while doing basic things (not overclocked higher than EVGA's base) I have not found a single thing this is better at then my old 1060 aside from upping my game fps by about 10. If you are upgrading from a 10 series, stick with it until you can buy a 2080ti or something that is actually better than the last gen. It has more priority towards a single application so if you happen to listen to music or record your gameplay it will always prefer the program that is focused, meaning all the other things your doing will not operate how they should.
customer_reviews.author: CKerk

customer_reviews.title: RTX 2070 on Fire
customer_reviews.text: I took this thing out of the box and paired it with the new Z390 mobo set and a 9700k. My benchmarks were amazing @ 17564 on the passmark scores. I've been playing War Hammer Total War 2 on max settings 4k with no issues as long as I used DX11 (The game only has DX12 Beta suport and I had a couple crashes). This far exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Works good when it works
customer_reviews.text: It is a great card, when it works. Had it for two months and was running fine, then it failed and through artifacts all over the screen. Thought it might be something else but kept doing it. Evga is a great company to work with RMA was simple you pay for it there and they pay for replacement back with 3 year warranty so the risk is low but it failed. Never over clocked it but it had that "boost" thing built in so it did that naturally. So if you are looking for a video card and want some insurance go with EVGA. They do have 24/7 customer service out of California.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah 1up

customer_reviews.title: Great card easy to overclock!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card upgrading from GTX 1070ti FTW2 still a great card and will probably put it in my wife's rig. The card is an easy overclocker both manually and especially using Precision X1 slide the voltage the temp and power all the way over and hit scan, boom you have a stable overclock. I've always buy EVGA GPU's they don't seem to skimp on quality but I've learned not to buy the entry level or "black editions" they are no the same quality as the the mid to high range cards, that's just my opinion. Other than that excellent card.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Davis

customer_reviews.title: Soso
customer_reviews.text: I honestly feel like I was getting better performance from my GTX 970, maybe games aren't optimized for the 2070 yet but it was a hefty investment. I had (well still have) an issue where when the fans spin down they make contact with something within the shroud causing a "ticking" noise as it catches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Card - Very Overclockable - Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought a GPU for awhile, and I wanted to get into 144hz so I went for the EVGA RTX 2070 Black. Runs great right out of the box, but after pushing it a little in EVGA X1 (their stock overclocking software) got my core clock from 1410mhz to 2010mhz without much issue. I can run Heaven Benchmark with Ultra quality at 1080p at about 180-190hz, more than enough for my 144hz G-Sync Monitor. Tech support is also very good. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Overbeck

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 1080p!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, plays everything maxed out at 2560 a 1080 with decent fps. Only gave 4 stars because mine makes a slight ticking noise but only at a certain rpm and only one fan does it. As far as I can tell it's to do with how the one fan came out of the mold and just had a tiny bit extra plastic on the edge of it.
customer_reviews.author: Faster Tomorrow

customer_reviews.title: stuttering, and really hot.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this product a week ago, at first the card would get into the 90's so i cranked the fan speeds up witch did help. but then i started to notice all the games i play started stuttering is the start of the game. i tried resetting driver (it did not work) so decided to send it back and try another model.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Opsahl

customer_reviews.title: Triple slot! Quiet, high performance and great cooling.
customer_reviews.text: EVGA 2070 XC Ultra, Great card, nice and quiet even during AAA gaming. My first triple slot card. It fits well and doesn't have a noticeable sag to it. Ray tracing isnt the best but it is there... However I bought the card more for the DLSS tensor core anti aliasing. Performance wise it is between a 1080 and a 1080ti/2080. Really happy with the look Evga gave it. Clear shroud shows those beefy 6 heat pipes and Evga Geforce RTX 2070 rgb leds to shine on the cooler. I definitely would buy again no doubts.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice first graphics card
customer_reviews.text: I built a gaming PC for myself and kids but decided to add a graphics card after determining that the AMD Ryzen APU wasn't going to allow me to play Battlefield V. I decided to invest quite a bit in this card for high performance and the prospect of advanced features such as ray tracing (for future games). This card is plenty powerful enough for me and I can't wait to pair it with a more powerful CPU to remove my CPU bottleneck. I'm happy with my purchase so far and would recommend this card for 1080p gaming on ultra settings.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Bad card... Don’t buy...
customer_reviews.text: Two DIsplay ports DOA, Thrid one worked for a little while then that died too... BSOD on this card, colors are completely out of wack on start of a game. Screen tearing like no other... DONT BUY. You’ll have issues eventually with these 20xx cards give it some time for them to figure out all the bugs.
customer_reviews.author: dolly

customer_reviews.title: Good card, poor overclocking software.
customer_reviews.text: The software to overclock this card is not good. You’ll spend quite a bit of time just dealing with it’s bugs/oddities just to get a bit more speed out of the card. In terms of price/performance it’s a good but at this point.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great Graphics, but pricer than other rtx 2070
customer_reviews.text: I bought this graphics card for my new pc build, sporting a 2700x and a ROG Strix motherboard. This graphics card has been amazing in game performance. It can run games like fortnite and Battlefield V on max settings at 140 fps, with the core clock at only 40%. When overclocked, this GPU can run these games at 160 fps and above easily. Highly recommended. The downfall of this graphics card is the price, which is a good 20 dollars more expensive then most of the other 2070s I can find even from the same brand. Overall, I would recommend this product because of extreme performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service from evga & affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Buyer from Malaysia, received the card within a week. Faced some minor problems when I first installing the card, however evga customer service is really there to solve customer’s problems. Their responsiveness is just insane, almost like instant reply. So far the card works fine, just the fan sound abit loud at max speed.
customer_reviews.author: Boon

customer_reviews.title: Most cost-effective upgrade for Geforce 9XX until the 2070 Supers are in supply
customer_reviews.text: I could list all the benchmarks, but you've probably already seen them. Go for this one; EVGA outdid themselves and after several hours of research, this was what I picked as a replacement for my 970. This is the best bang for your buck as of 8/21/19 in regards to framerate. Consider getting a 144hz gaming monitor to go with it to really bring out the benefit. I picked up an IPS panel monitor and after the sticker shock wore off...no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Jaded Nostalgic

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast
customer_reviews.text: So this is my first high end GPU, so no experience at the same level to compare it to. With that said, this is a beast. I started a couple of years ago with a 1050ti then earlier this year upgraded to a 1660ti, now to this. It's a bigger step up than the 1050 to 1660 for gaming. I was given a 27" 1440 monitor and have only been able to use it at 1080, but now at 1440 it's great. Higher resolution with even higher fps with even higher settings.
customer_reviews.author: Chad B.

customer_reviews.title: Samsung RAM <3, No thermal issues, No glitching, NOT MICRON RAM!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing you need to know is this version was Samsung RAM onboard. This alone make it worth the price. Micron just dies after a few weeks to as month. 2070 is the best value for money, NOTE: You cannot claim any EVGA or Nvidia games with this purchase, Amazon is not in partnership with them. RTX is worth it for the performance alone, only a 1080-TI can come close in the price range.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFrom-a-FlatState

customer_reviews.title: It’s massive and awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a RTX 2070 for goodness sake!!! This is the greatest video card I’ve ever owned. Thank you Amazon for giving me the payment options to be able to afford such a wonderful product. So far the card has exceeded my expectations. The X1 software is a little confusing but with YouTube videos and evga support, I figured it out. The box is a great presentation btw.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: good VFM for solid 1080p/2K gaming experience
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the RTX 2070 so far. it's price on black friday was very close to the gtx 1080 i planned to buy, so overall i am happy with my choise. drawback: the rtx texhnology is not ready yet, and if the price was not very close to the gtx 1080 i wouldn't have bought it, as the cards perform very similarly. also, i would advise watching some reviews on youtube before buying, just for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great graphics card. No RGB but you also don't have to pay for the RGB. If you are looking for a cheap 2070 then this is your graphics card. It's smaller than cards with 3 fans and not as heavy. It doesn't have the aluminum plate covering the PCB which exposes the soldering and circuits, but it also looks cool to see the circuits.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Running 3x1080p for iRacing. Getting in the neighborhood of 230 fps with nearly all setting maxed. This is with just me on the track. Haven't progressed in the game to where I'm ready to jump into a race. Of course I'll lose FPS with more cars on screen but I have plenty of headroom for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Swisher

customer_reviews.title: If you have other rgb components that are NOT EVGA don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: As the title says don't buy this unless you have everything rgb in your case from evga. It requires you to use evgas awful rgb controller built into the precision X1 software and will not work with anything else (aura synch for example). Other than that it's a 2070 and works as intended performance wise. I would return it and get a different one but for this price I can't find any other rgb 2070s. I'll just have to struggle with 2 separate rgb programs for now.
customer_reviews.author: Tomi Sheares

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others have experienced with this particular 2070, mine arrived artifacting out of the gate, creating sparkles and flares across the screen. Eventually, games just began to crash and ultimately wouldn’t open. Personally, I’d be cautious about purchasing this particular 2070 and I’ve returned it to amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: ColinDep

customer_reviews.title: Started showing artifacts and crashes after 2-3 months of gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I got a 950 EVGA card before and it is working until now, but this 2070 Black Ed that I purchased last December 6, 2018 it is showing artifacts followed by crash. I tried using updated drivers, reinstalling drivers, using HDMI instead of my normal Display port, to no avail. Using the max fan speed seems to delay the issue and lowering resolutions but it defeats the purpose of me upgrading to this card from my EVGA 950.
customer_reviews.author: Espie Bierra

customer_reviews.title: Solid GPU without RGB
customer_reviews.text: This 2070 has been great so far. Rarely goes above 63c during a full load and is running all of the games I play at 144 FPS on 1440p without an issue. Took away one star because there is no RGB and I have been fighting with Amazon for 2 weeks to get the code for Anthem or Battlefield.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Great graphics card
customer_reviews.text: This card is installed in a AMD system. Nvidia drivers are the only downfall of the card but using MSI afterburner and Kombuster I was able to tune the card and D2 is running @ 200 fps. You have to manually set the fan curve or the card will overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. S

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT !!!
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a new gaming build because after much deliberation I decided on this for the $$ and am very well pleased with it . I played Fallout 4 last night for 5-6 hours and it performed great and never got above 56 c . EVGA I knew made a good product but this GPU is outstanding for the money . WHAT a good deal ! $545.00 before taxes .
customer_reviews.author: ItchyTaint

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card
customer_reviews.text: I know the price is high, but the performance of this card is high. Very high. A beast. I upgraded from a GTX 980. I read a lot about this card and had benchmarks memorized, and am still shocked at how well this card performs. It dominates FC New Dawn. Full load temps below 60c ??? Without any adjustments it boosts over 2000Mhz !!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stuman

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU
customer_reviews.text: The GPU works great and improve the games I play that can go higher frames while in high settings on the graphics. I had a GTX 1050 ti before having the RTX 2070.
customer_reviews.author: Kud

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from an old gtx 770 so it is a clear improvement. I can finally run max settings on all my games at 1440p resolution and what a difference it made! Probably not worth upgrading if you have a 1060 or 1070, but well worth it for any older card. This will last a good 3 to 5 years before another upgrade is needed.
customer_reviews.author: likes toys

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had no problems with this card. I can run all games at ultra settings (fallen order witcher 3 and PUBG with no imput lag. I have tried to play the new Call of Duty at ultra settings but after wvery death, my game crashes. I dont know if its my card or if its the game bugging out. Its works well with v/freesync displays. Before you buy, i would recommend reading some of the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Alex McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I returned the stranded RTX 2070 black and got this one instead. I had issues with it at first, I couldn’t update the driver because it wasn’t compatible with my version of windows. I had to manually go to the Microsoft website and download windows and everything that I was finally able to get it working. Other than that I have had no problems with it and it really performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no issue or artifacts as some have reported and is very quiet. At the current time I am very happy with this GPU! Note: i got two of the overclocked Evga rtx 2070’s (one for someone else with i7 9700k) and they both have Samsung memory if anyone was curious. (My Build has a i9 9900k)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly (Kyber3000)

customer_reviews.title: Stick with gtx
customer_reviews.text: I've never had so many issues with a graphics card. Every other game doesn't work. I'm back to using my old gtx 1060 which works perfectly. I'm not sure if it was just my card or rtx in general, I'd guess a bit of both.
customer_reviews.author: Beck Bristow

customer_reviews.title: The EVGA RTX 2070 Very Good Video Card
customer_reviews.text: Good Deal Bang for Buck! I had been worried about upgrading my existing 1070 cards, but when I built a New System, getting The RTX 2070 was a good value. So far after 1 month, it works real smooth despite internet complaints about card failures. I would recommend this card to anyone who does video editing, multitask graphics, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fowler

customer_reviews.title: If you’re considering a 10xx series, shop this card!
customer_reviews.text: A great blend of performance and cost. EVGA Cards are engineered to run at lower temperatures, especially the XC Ultra.
customer_reviews.author: T Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you get one that works
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for less than two weeks. Constant crashes and hard crashes within the first 1-2 minutes of starting any game, from RDR2 to KOTOR 2. Seems I got one of those defective models, tried everything to fix the problem, checked all software and hardware. Took this out, reinstalled my old workhorse GTX 970, and boom everything worked as it should. I returned this and will be getting a 2080.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary N Losee

customer_reviews.title: Build a gaming tower of a friend.
customer_reviews.text: My buddy has had no problems what so ever with this card. He plays Battle Field 5 and several other games. Parts also included: Ryzen 7 2700X 16GB of Corsair DDR4 3200 RGB Pro Ram B450 ROG-F Corsair 850 PSU
customer_reviews.author: M Technologies Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this unit since I have gone from 30fps gaming, which is pretty much unplayable for fast paced games like PUBG where you have to be ready at all times for anything. I can now run every single game I own at maximim settings at LEAST 70fps.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic video card
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical about getting this video card due to the artifacting issue this series was having but I ended up taking the leap and here I am a few months later leaving this review. I upgraded from a gtx 960 and the performance has increased significantly without issue. I havent experimented much with rtx mode due to the lack of fps but when I did the picture quality looked pretty darn sexy. The fans can be a little loud under load but they shut off not too long after so I definitely dont have any complaints about that. Could be because my case is an old pos. Lol. 10/10 card
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Prime-day sales
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on prime day at $449.99 before taxes. Paired this with an LG 34 ultrawide gsync 144hz monitor very happy with purchase. Was going to wait for supers to drive prices lower but couldn't resist a good sale.
customer_reviews.author: Yrojn

customer_reviews.title: Best performance for price card available.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card at 549.99 and gotta say it is worth it. If you compare it to other popular cards like the 1080/1080ti, the RTX 2070 fares better than the 1080 and about the same as the 1080ti. The card gets better frames than the 1080 in triple a titles and in games like Fortnite, PUBG, APEX, and League. Overall with the 2070 being a fairly new card I'd say this is a safe buy if you're looking to upgrade an older GPU to stay up to date or if you're planning on building a new rig and aren't looking to break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died quickly
customer_reviews.text: Died 25 minutes after installed. Bought a similar XC Ultra that has been running 24 hours straight now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Running Great, Fairly Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Not too much fan whine, though there is some at a higher pitch when it really needs to work. Not enough to be an issue. Performance is very good for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend this
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews specifically about this card before buying it, I was nervous because about 10-15% of reviewers said it was DOA or died within the first month, I’ve had it about 3 months now and works perfectly. There’s not many games out right now that pushes it to max, though I expect in the next year or two there will be. Before this card I was running a 970 and 960 SLI and they were being pushed pretty hard, they were also very loud at times, while this card handles those same games quieter with higher fps. TLDR; worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Sweetland

customer_reviews.title: Ray Tracing is amazing. Good power for non RT games.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 970 to this. BIG performance bump. Tomb Raider looks just godly on this with a gsync monitor. Treat yo sef and invest in a nice monitor and graphics card to last you for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent RTX 2070 Display Card
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this card is excellent. It is fast, stable and quiet. Both the power consumption and temperature is lower than my expectation and installation is smooth also. Just used it for a few days and I hope it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: My word was this hard to use. 4/10 don't recommend for newbies.
customer_reviews.text: I had to do two full passes with a DDU and still got a black screen until I used the HDMI instead of the DVI-D, good thing I figured out that the DVI-D is the issue or I would have RMAed the card again. Constant crashes with the first one no matter what I did. In the end when I FINALLY got it to work it runs everything like a boss. would not recommend unless you have experience building PCs.
customer_reviews.author: Asa Weitkamp

customer_reviews.title: Best value RTX
customer_reviews.text: Runs all games in high or ultra settings with no frame tare or drop. Hasnt gave me any issues. Love precision X1 software too.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good card but only
customer_reviews.text: Really good card, the only negative is the price hike from last gen cards. RTX is pretty much useless on this card unless you play at 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: Dario L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from the 900 series cards
customer_reviews.text: Went from 2 EVGA 980 superclocked cards to this 2070 so far so good, could not run ultra settings on most newer games with good frame rates with the 980’s so I decided to upgrade. If you don’t want to spend 800+ on the 2080 I would highly recommend this card especially for 1080p gaming and 1440p.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Regular artifacts and dropped frames
customer_reviews.text: Despite keeping drivers up to date this card will display artifacts and drop several frame at regular intervals, for a card in this price range I would expect it to be a little more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: LMG86

customer_reviews.title: Works just how it is advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It works well. It’s built well and does what it advertises. The only complaint about the product is the clicking sounds the fans make when they activate. I play with them in smart mode so they only kick on when necessary. The price is pretty outrageous but that’s what Nvidia does it seems. All in all I’m happy with it. It’s also very sexy so make sure you get a case that shows it off or what’s the point amirite?
customer_reviews.author: Sinclair Fay

customer_reviews.title: I would say, worth the saving.
customer_reviews.text: RTX 2070 is a very powerful card. This card exceeded my expectations. Do not listen to anyone who say this card is bad, especially EVGA product. I came from very older generation from AMD and I regret nothing. I can play all the games with 100+ FPS on High setting on 1440p. Just do not go crazy and set settings to ultra like stupid people on YouTube. While gaming you will not notice difference between both High and Ultra on 1440p.
customer_reviews.author: Adel Maher Abboud

customer_reviews.title: Looks great in my Rig!
customer_reviews.text: Games beautifully, looks awesome and has given me zero problems. I am an over clocker and unless I won the silicon lottery, you can expect nice gains in Memory and GPU clocks. Pushes my 1440p 144Hz monitor easily when gaming.
customer_reviews.author: PuterGeek2

customer_reviews.title: A BEAST
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and installed it in alienware external graphics amplifier. Pairing it on Alienware 17 R4 external monitor. It's a beast - UPDATE those Geforce graphics drivers first (y)
customer_reviews.author: Tee Thuy

customer_reviews.title: Error code 43 after one week of use
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly fine for the first week before crashing and getting an error 43 code in device manager. Clean uninstalled all drivers and registrys, clean install drivers, checked GPU fitment, checked PSU and cables....nothing. Returned and got a different card.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Wood

customer_reviews.title: Cooling could be better
customer_reviews.text: Id give it 5 stars if the cooling was better, playing One Piece World Seeker on ultra settings makes the gpu very hot even with three additional fans over it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: EVGA GeForce RTX 2070 Black GAMING,8GB GDDR6, Dual HDB Fans Graphics Card 08G-P4-1071-KR
product_meta.description: Style:Graphics Card| Size:Black EditionThe EVGA GeForce RTX 20-Series Graphics Cards are powered by the all-new NVIDIA Turing architecture to give you incredible new levels of gaming realism, speed, power efficiency, and immersion. With the EVGA GeForce RTX 20-Series gaming cards you get the best gaming experience with next generation graphics performance, ice cold cooling, and advanced overclocking features with the all new EVGA Precision X1software. The new NVIDIA GeForce RTX GPUs have reinvented graphics and set a new bar for performance. Powered by the new NVIDIA Turing GPU architecture and the revolutionary NVIDIA RTX platform, the new graphics cards bring together real-time ray tracing, artificial intelligence, and programmable shading. This is not only a whole new way to experience games - this is the ultimate PC gaming experience. Requirements - Minimum of a 550 Watt power supply and Minimum of a 550 Watt power supply.
feature_bullets: Real Boost Clock: 1620 MegaHertZ; memory Detail: 8192MB GDDR6. Operating System Support :Windows 10 64bit, Windows 7 64bit
Dual HDB fans and all new cooler offer higher performance cooling and much quieter acoustic noise
Built for EVGA Precision x1, EVGA all new tuning utility monitors your graphics card and gives you the power to overclock like a Pro
Get grip game + EVGA vehicle skin w/ Purchase, redeemed at EVGA website, while supplies last

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars787 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
